A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I was really hoping for something closer to Rogue One or Empire Strikes Back.  Instead I got Rubber fish and chickens\, Leia flying through space (Smelly feet bad cheese)\, and a washed up Luke Skywalker.  This will go down as the worst Star Wars movie of all time.  Hell\, this movie makes the original trilogy\, Jar Jar Binks and all\, more desirable.  Why can't we get gritty again ala Rogue One\, Empire Strikes Back\, and even the Force Awakens.  Leave the Mickey Mouse shit for the cartoons and quit F***ing with the trilogies.  Stop trying so hard to get laughs and let them come from the situations the characters find themselves in.  I loved Looper and had great hopes for this film when I heard Rian Johnson was slated to Direct\, but in the end it seemed like he was kept on too tight a leash.
